channel.title: Superbus via Inscientiae
channel.description: The logo on the lobby floor of the main pedestrian entrance into the Black Mesa complex, now on the wall in the new version of the game. It translates thus: "Proud of the Way of Ignorance". Sound kinda strange. Any theories as to why this was chosen? I think original dev team must have been poking fun of the whole incident, the circumstances it all came to be, and the follow up actions of the gov with the clean up team and all.. Its cool Valve stuff as always tho!

item.title: Superbus via Inscientiae
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I like that the Latin isn’t entirely accurate.

In Portal 2, Cave Johnson said, “Just a heads up, we’re gonna have a superconductor turned up full blast and pointed at you for the duration of this next test. I’ll be honest, we’re throwing science at the walls here to see what sticks. No idea what it’ll do.”

Black Mesa might be similar: They act like they know what they’re doing but…

stormseeker appears to answer that question:

stormseeker:

The original texture artist had created the logo and motto of the labs based on a rough interpretation from a friend she knew.

The original texture artist was Karen Laur. She worked for Valve January 1997 through March 1999.

item.title: Superbus via Inscientiae
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
stormseeker:

The original texture artist had created the logo and motto of the labs based on a rough interpretation from a friend she knew. I could have translated the correct version of this, and had a new motto placed by the logo. However, I consider this logo to be one of the more iconic and memorable parts of the chapter, and even changing the wording would detract from it.
